alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 14 at 3:25PM EDT until May 14 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Greensville County in southeastern Virginia... Central Southampton County in southeastern Virginia... Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... Southeastern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stony Creek, or 10 miles northeast of Purdy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Stony Creek around 335 PM EDT. Sussex around 400 PM EDT. Homeville around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Owens, Newville, Booker, Yale, Lumberton, Huske, Littleton and Hilda. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
